AttributeType.name: filespec
AttributeType.description: File specification. Can include wildcard characters ? and *

AttributeType.name: path
AttributeType.description: Path to a file. The path can include environment variables or values extracted from registry keys.

AttributeType.name: recursive
AttributeType.description: Is path specified recursive or limited to the directory that is specified.

AttributeType.name: alternatePath
AttributeType.description: Alternate path in which to find the file. Files in a file group may have been copied to an alternative location by the writer. Backup should pick up the files from the alternative location instead of the original location but should restore the files to their original location

AttributeType.name: logicalPath
AttributeType.description: Logical path for a Writer component. This logical name uses backslash as separators to form a logical namespace hierarchy

AttributeType.name: componentName
AttributeType.description: Name used to identify a Writer component. May be qualified by a logical path.

AttributeType.name: instanceName
AttributeType.description: This provides the writer with a unique instance id that persists between backup and restore. This allows the backup application to handle multiple writer instances at restore time.

ElementType.name: TestWriter
ElementType.description: Configuration information for the VSS Test Writer.

AttributeType.name: usage
AttributeType.description: How the data associated with the writer is used.

AttributeType.name: timestamped
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports timestamped components or not.

AttributeType.name: supportsNewTarget
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports new target operations or not.

AttributeType.name: supportsRestoreWithMove
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports redirecting components at restore time.

AttributeType.name: supportsCopy
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports copy backups.

AttributeType.name: supportsDifferential
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports differential backups.

AttributeType.name: supportsIncremental
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports incremental backups.

AttributeType.name: supportsLog
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports Log backups.

AttributeType.name: supportsAuthRestore
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports authoritative restore.

AttributeType.name: supportsRollforward
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports rollforward restore.

AttributeType.name: supportsRestoreRename
AttributeType.description: Whether this writer supports component rename at restore time.

AttributeType.name: verbosity
AttributeType.description: Whether verbose output is enabled. low: Messages are not printed if files are not properly restored medium: Most general messages are printed, including warnings if files are not restored high: Extremely verbose output is enabled.

AttributeType.name: checkExcludes
AttributeType.description: Whether to check that excluded files are not restored at restore time. If restoring to a location that may contain files matching the exclude list, set this to false to prevent spurious warnings.

AttributeType.name: checkIncludes
AttributeType.description: Whether to check that included files are restored at restore time.

AttributeType.name: deleteFiles
AttributeType.description: whether to delete files from original volume after snapshot is taken

AttributeType.name: deletePartialFiles
AttributeType.description: whether to delete partial files from original volume after snapshot is taken

AttributeType.name: deleteDifferencedFiles
AttributeType.description: whether to delete differenced files from original volume after snapshot is taken

AttributeType.name: majorVersion
AttributeType.description: Major version number of the writer.

AttributeType.name: minorVersion
AttributeType.description: Minor version number of the writer.

AttributeType.name: excludeLowPriority
AttributeType.description: whether to exclude files using low-priority IO

ElementType.name: RestoreMethod
ElementType.description: How restore should be performed. Includes specification of how files should be restored as well as special steps that should occur in order to complete the restore.

AttributeType.name: method
AttributeType.dt:values: RESTORE_IF_NONE_THERE RESTORE_IF_CAN_BE_REPLACED STOP_RESTART_SERVICE REPLACE_AT_REBOOT REPLACE_AT_REBOOT_IF_CANNOT_REPLACE RESTORE_TO_ALTERNATE_LOCATION CUSTOM
AttributeType.description:
RESTORE_IF_NONE_THERE: i.e., can restore data if it is not at the location where it was backed up from. This essentially allows data to be restored to a clean system RESTORE_IF_CAN_BE_REPLACED: Restore data if all of the files can be replaced in the orgiginal backup location. Fails if any of the files are open. If an alternate location is provided, files will be placed there if they cannot be restored to their original location. STOP_RESTART_SERVICE: stop service (service attribute must be specified). Restore files to original backup location. Restart service. Fails if any of the files are open after the service is stopped. REPLACE_AT_REBOOT: Restore files to a temporary location. Use MoveFileEx to replace the files at reboot. REPLACE_AT_REBOOT_IF_CANNOT_REPLACE: Similiar to REPLACE_AT_REBOOT however files may be restored in place in they are not busy. All files within a component must be either completely replaced in place or completely replaced at reboot, so if one component file is busy, all files in that component must be replaced at reboot.
RESTORE_TO_ALTERNATIVE_LOCATION: Restore files to an alternate location. Typically writerRestore will indicate that the writer will participate in the restore process CUSTOM: Custom restore method. Requestor's should not handle this case at all for this writer.

AttributeType.name: service
AttributeType.description: Must be specified if method="STOP_RESTART_SERVICE", indicates service to be stopped before restoring files.

AttributeType.name: writerRestore
AttributeType.description: Whether writer should be invoked after files are restored to disk. Options are always, never, and ifReplaceFails. The latter means that the files will be restored to their original location. If one or more of the files cannot be replaced, then the files will be restored to an alternate location (must be specified via ALTERNATE_LOCATION_MAPPING. After the files are restored, the writer is invoked.

AttributeType.name: rebootRequired
AttributeType.description: Should a reboot be performed after restoring the data for this writer

ElementType.name: Dependency
ElementType.description: A dependency from one component to another component in another writer.

AttributeType.name: writerId
AttributeType.description: Id of writer that this component is dependent on.

ElementType.name: ComponentFile
ElementType.description: Location of a file in a component. For database components, the alternatePath attribute is ignored.

AttributeType.name: fullBackupRequired
AttributeType.description: Whether this file needs backing up during a full backup.

AttributeType.name: diffBackupRequired
AttributeType.description: Whether this file needs backing up during a differential backup.

AttributeType.name: incBackupRequired
AttributeType.description: Whether this file needs backing up during an incremental backup.

AttributeType.name: logBackupRequired
AttributeType.description: Whether this file needs backing up during a log backup.

AttributeType.name: fullSnapshotRequired
AttributeType.description: Whether this file needs to be copied off of a snapshot during a full backup.

AttributeType.name: diffSnapshotRequired
AttributeType.description: Whether this file needs to be copied off of a snapshot during a differential backup.

AttributeType.name: incSnapshotRequired
AttributeType.description: Whether this file needs to be copied off of a snapshot during an incremental backup.

AttributeType.name: logSnapshotRequired
AttributeType.description: Whether this file needs to be copied off of a snapshot during a log backup.

AttributeType.name: nonSnapshotFile
AttributeType.description: If the file is not being copied off of the snapshot volume, it is replaced by this file in PostSnapshot. This ensures that the requestor does not back up the file off of the snapshot

ElementType.name: ExcludeFile
ElementType.description: Location of a file that the writer should mark as excluded from backup.

ElementType.name: ExcludeFileFromSnapshot
ElementType.description: Location of a file that the writer should mark as excluded from a snapshot.

ElementType.name: DifferencedFile
ElementType.description: Differenced files that the writer will add during PostSnapshot

AttributeType.name: year
AttributeType.description: The time that indicates the point of the last backup.

AttributeType.name: month
AttributeType.description: The time that indicates the point of the last backup.

AttributeType.name: day
AttributeType.description: The time that indicates the point of the last backup.

AttributeType.name: hour
AttributeType.description: The time that indicates the point of the last backup.

AttributeType.name: minute
AttributeType.description: The time that indicates the point of the last backup.

AttributeType.name: second
AttributeType.description: The time that indicates the point of the last backup.

ElementType.name: PartialFile
ElementType.description: Partial file specification that the writer will add during PostSnapshot

AttributeType.name: ranges
AttributeType.description: This range list has the form (offset:length ...) where offset is the byte offset in the file to be backed up and length is the length of the data to be backed up. Both are 32 bit integers (for this version of the writer). The ranges must be monotonically increasing and must not overlap. If the rangelist is not specified then the entire file should be backed up.

ElementType.name: Component
ElementType.description: Description of a Writer component. Currently this can describe either a file-group component or a database component.

AttributeType.name: componentType
AttributeType.description: specified the type of a Writer component

AttributeType.name: selectable
AttributeType.description: Is this component selectable for backup or is it always backed up. If no, then the component is always backed up if any other components of the application/service are backed up. If yes, then the component may be selectively backed up.

AttributeType.name: selectableForRestore
AttributeType.description: Is this component selectable for restore

AttributeType.name: restoreTarget
AttributeType.description: Allows the writer to override the restore method for this component in the PreRestore event. VSS_RT_ORIGINAL_LOCATION: all files in this component should be restored to their original locations. VSS_RT_ALTERNATE: all files in this component should be restored to the previously specified alternate location

AttributeType.name: autoRecover
AttributeType.description: When auto recovery is required

ElementType.name: FailEvent
ElementType.description: Specifies an event that the Test Writer will fail.

AttributeType.name: writerEvent
AttributeType.dt:values: Identify PrepareForBackup PrepareForSnapshot Freeze Thaw PostSnapshot Abort BackupComplete BackupShutdown PreRestore PostRestore
AttributeType.description: Defines the list of events that a Writer can fail.

AttributeType.name: retryable
AttributeType.description: Whether the failure should be retryable or not

AttributeType.name: numFailures
AttributeType.description: If the failure is retryable, then this parameter indicates the number of times the writer should fail the event.

ElementType.name: AlternateLocationMapping
ElementType.description: Mapping from a location that was backed up to a location to restore to.
